perturbation.original_text: South African working hours: 8h00 – 20h00 during South African workdays.
perturbation.changed_text: South African working hours: 8h00 – 17h00 during South African workdays.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of South African working hours states it is from 8h00 to 20h00. The modification changes it to 8h00 to 17h00. This contradiction creates uncertainty regarding the service availability times defined in other sections, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
EIT is responsible for any damages caused to the Customer or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.

Nevertheless, EIT will be free of responsibility, in case of not satisfying its obligations, if he can prove that this was due to force majeure or external causes out of his control, like accidents, natural disasters, vandalism acts or theft.
perturbation.changed_text:
EIT is responsible for any damages caused to the Customer or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.

Nevertheless, EIT will be free of responsibility, in case of not satisfying its obligations, if he subjectively feels unable to perform the duties.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of liability carves out exceptions for force majeure. The modified version introduces 'subjectively feels unable to perform the duties', which creates a broad, vague exception to liability. This contrasts with the original, more specific exceptions, leading to ambiguity on when EIT is actually liable.

perturbation.original_text: Except as provided hereinafter, for a period of five years after termination or expiration of this Agreement, each party shall not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential.
perturbation.changed_text: Except as provided hereinafter, for a period of one year after termination or expiration of this Agreement, each party shall not disclose, publish or disseminate information received from the other party which may be required to carry out this Agreement and which the disclosing party deems proprietary and confidential.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the confidentiality period is five years after termination, while the modified text changes it to one year. This contradiction creates uncertainty about the actual duration of confidentiality obligations.
